conversations.description: Teacher asks a quick poll on today's topic, and the LLM records each student's answer with timestamps.
After a group discussion, the LLM computes real‑time engagement scores for the whole class.
A teacher wants to see which students have not contributed in the past 30 minutes and receives a list.
The LLM pulls a student's profile to contextualize a sudden drop in participation.
During a lesson, the LLM detects a student’s silence for 5 minutes and sends an alert to the teacher.
At the end of class, the system generates a markdown report summarizing participation metrics.
A teacher requests a comparison of engagement between two consecutive lessons.
The LLM flags a student whose engagement score falls below a threshold and suggests an intervention.
Students answer an open‑ended question; the LLM records each response and tags them by prompt ID.
A teacher asks for the top three most active participants of the day.
The LLM calculates average response latency after each teacher prompt.
During a virtual lab, the LLM tracks how many students submit their observations on time.
A teacher wants a heat map of participation across breakout rooms.
The system sends a push notification to a teacher when a student repeatedly submits empty responses.
After a quiz, the LLM aggregates correct vs. incorrect answer ratios per student.
A teacher asks for a summary of engagement trends for the past week.
The LLM cross‑references a student's attendance record with their chat activity.
During a debate, the LLM logs each argument and measures how evenly the floor is shared.
A teacher requests a list of students who have improved their participation scores over the semester.
The LLM automatically sends a congratulatory email to high‑engagement students after a session.
A teacher wants to see engagement broken down by gender or other demographic from profiles.
The system detects a sudden spike in off‑topic messages and notifies the instructor.
After a lecture, the LLM generates a visual chart of participation per minute.
A teacher asks the LLM to filter engagement metrics for a specific student across multiple classes.
The LLM logs a student's request for clarification and marks it for follow‑up.
During a peer‑review activity, the LLM records which students gave feedback to whom.
A teacher wants a quick count of how many students answered a true/false poll correctly.
The LLM identifies a student who has not posted in the chat for three days and alerts the teacher.
After a collaborative coding session, the LLM provides a report on each learner’s contribution frequency.
A teacher queries the LLM for average engagement scores across different subjects.
The system logs a student’s response to a reflective prompt and timestamps it for later review.
During a role‑play, the LLM tracks how many times each student takes the speaking turn.
A teacher requests a downloadable CSV of all chat responses for a given homework assignment.
The LLM detects that a student’s response time is increasing over the session and flags possible fatigue.
After a class, the LLM sends a summary email to the teacher with key engagement highlights.
A teacher asks the LLM to compare engagement between synchronous and asynchronous activities.
The LLM aggregates sentiment scores from open‑ended responses to gauge class mood.
During a live poll, the LLM updates the teacher with the percentage of participants who have voted.
A teacher wants to know which students consistently skip optional discussion prompts.
The system triggers an alert when a student’s participation drops below 20% of the class average.
After a guest lecture, the LLM creates a report showing which students asked follow‑up questions.
A teacher asks for a drill‑down view of engagement by time of day across the semester.
The LLM records responses to a Kahoot‑style quiz and computes per‑student accuracy.
During a case‑study discussion, the LLM logs each student’s contribution and categorizes by theme.
A teacher receives a push notification that a student has posted multiple off‑topic messages in a row.
The LLM generates a markdown report that includes participation graphs and top‑performing students.
A teacher asks the LLM to filter engagement metrics for students with specific learning accommodations.
The system integrates with the LMS to pull a student’s GPA and correlate it with engagement levels.
After a collaborative project, the LLM provides a breakdown of each team member’s chat activity.
A teacher wants a quick glance at who has not responded to the last three prompts.
The LLM detects a pattern of late responses from a student and suggests a one‑on‑one check‑in.
During a live coding demo, the LLM tracks how many students ask for clarification at each step.
A teacher requests a summary of engagement for the entire department for the past month.
The LLM flags a student whose engagement score spikes dramatically after a sudden grade drop.
After a lesson on ethics, the LLM aggregates student statements and highlights common concerns.
